marketNews.title: China Likely to Cut Low-Grade Coal Imports
marketNews.content: Bloomberg reported that China is likely to cut imports of low-grade coal, a development that could create negative sentiment for exporters such as Indonesia. The outlook is based on a surplus of coal supply in China and the Chinese government’s effort to tighten carbon emissions. China Huadian Corp., one of the largest power generators in China, forecasts total coal imports to be only about 400 million tonnes in 2025, far below the record 543 million tonnes in 2024. This projection is even lower than the estimate from the China Coal Transportation and Distribution Association earlier this year, which projected 2025 imports at about 525 million tonnes. Analyst Li Xuegang of the Association said that thermal coal imports have fallen for three consecutive months as of May 2025 and he expects the downward trend to accelerate for the rest of the year. Previously, commodity-analysis firm Kpler recorded that thermal coal imports to Asia reached 74.12 million tonnes in May 2025, up +8.1 % month-on-month (MoM) while still down -5.3 % year-on-year (YoY). This marked the highest monthly Asian thermal-coal import volume in the past five months, amid weakening Indonesian and Australian coal prices to a four-year low due to higher domestic supply in China and India. Cumulatively over the first five months of 2025, Asian thermal-coal imports fell 7 % YoY to 346.96 million tonnes, according to Kpler data.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway – Impact of China’s Low-Grade Coal Import Cuts on Indonesian Exporters
marketNews.content: Potential Chinese cuts to low-grade coal imports could negatively affect Indonesian coal exporters. The companies with exposure to China and selling low-calorie coal – identified by an average selling price (ASP) around ICI4 (4,200 GAR) – are PTBA (3.4 % of total 2024 sales volume), KKGI (32 %), INDY (35.8 %), and BYAN (20 %).

marketNews.title: Top Gainer
marketNews.content: The top-gainer list for the day shows $TOBA up +15.71 %, $PGEO up +10.33 %, $RAJA up +5.26 %, and $SURI up +4.62 %.

marketNews.title: Top Loser
marketNews.content: The top-loser list for the day shows $PGAS down -10.88 %, $UNIQ down -10.67 %, $MTEL down -5.00 %, and $WIFI down -4.19 %.

marketNews.title: Other Hot Topics to Know
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia reported that Indonesia’s consumer confidence index (IKK) fell to 117.5 in May 2025 (down from 121.7 in April 2025), the lowest level since September 2022. The U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics reported that the U.S. consumer price index (CPI) rose 2.4 % YoY in May 2025 (vs. 2.3 % in April), slightly below the 2.5 % consensus, while month-on-month inflation was 0.1 % (vs. 0.2 % in April). Core CPI remained at 2.8 % YoY, unchanged for three months. Bloomberg reported that President Prabowo Subianto will visit Russian President Vladimir Putin in Russia on 18-20 June 2025, missing the G-7 summit in Canada; the foreign ministry said the trip had been planned before the G-7 invitation. The Solvent Extractors’ Association of India noted that Indian CPO imports rose 84 % MoM in May 2025 to 592,888 tonnes, the highest monthly level since November 2024, though still below the historical average of over 750,000 tonnes per month for the marketing year ending October 2024. GGN Research expects Indian CPO imports to rise to about 850,000 tonnes in June 2025, driven by cheaper CPO prices versus soy oil. Reuters said traders expect Indian vegetable-oil imports to increase in the coming months, supported by a tariff cut on vegetable-oil imports in India this month.

marketNews.title: Dari Laporan ke Lapangan: Menyibak Realita Bisnis di Balik Angka
marketNews.content: “Dari Laporan ke Lapangan: Menyibak Realita Bisnis di Balik Angka.” – Fadhilonn (source: https://stockbit.com/fadhilonn).

tickerNews.title: PTBA Approves 11.1% Dividend Yield for FY 2024
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of PT Bukit Asam approved a dividend of approximately IDR 3.8 trillion, or IDR 332 per share, representing a 75 % dividend payout ratio (same as 2023) and implying a dividend yield of 11.1 % as of Thursday 12 June. The cum-date and payment date were not disclosed.

tickerNews.title: TPIA Consideration of 10.57 % Stake Sale in Chandra Asri Pacific
tickerNews.content: Siam Cement Public Company Limited (BKK: SCC) announced that it is considering selling a 10.57 % stake in Chandra Asri Pacific. The sale is intended to reduce debt and reallocate capital to future business opportunities. The divestiture value was not disclosed; Siam Cement currently holds 30.57 % of TPIA through its subsidiary SCG Chemicals Public Company Limited.

tickerNews.title: ANTM Approves 100 % Dividend Payout for FY 2024
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Aneka Tambang approved a dividend of approximately IDR 3.6 trillion, or IDR 151.77 per share, representing a 100 % dividend payout ratio (same as 2023) and implying a dividend yield of 4.8 % as of Thursday 12 June. The cum-date and payment date were not disclosed.

tickerNews.title: ASII Wholesale Vehicle Sales Decline in May 2025
tickerNews.content: Astra International recorded wholesale vehicle sales of 34,480 units in May 2025 (-17 % YoY, +28 % MoM), a deeper year-over-year decline than the industry average (-15 % YoY, +18 % MoM), pushing its market share down to 56.9 % (vs. 57.9 % in May 2024 and 52.7 % in April 2025). The decline was driven by a 25 % YoY drop in Daihatsu sales to 11,166 units (+26 % MoM), while Toyota + Lexus sales were 21,241 units (-11 % YoY, +31 % MoM). Cumulatively, ASII’s wholesale sales for the first five months of 2025 fell to 172,268 units (-8 % YoY) with market share slipping to 54.3 % (vs. 56 % in 5M24).

tickerNews.title: ADHI Reports 72 % YoY Drop in New Contract Value for 1H 2025
tickerNews.content: Adhi Karya’s corporate secretary Rozi Sparta said the company recorded new contracts worth IDR 2.6 trillion in the first five months of 2025 (-72 % YoY), equal to 9.3-10.4 % of the 2025 target of IDR 25-28 trillion. The decline is attributed to the government’s adjustment of the infrastructure budget. New contracts for 2025 came from state-owned enterprises (56 %), the state budget (23 %), private sector (20 %) and loans (1 %).

tickerNews.title: HRTA Approves 3.3 % Dividend Yield for FY 2024
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Hartadinata Abadi approved a dividend of IDR 21 per share, equivalent to roughly 22 % dividend payout (2023: 23 %) and implying a 3.3 % dividend yield as of Thursday 12 June. The cum-date and payment date were not disclosed.

tickerNews.title: SMRA Declares 11 % Dividend Payout for FY 2024
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Summarecon Agung approved a dividend of approximately IDR 148.6 billion, or IDR 9 per share, representing an 11 % payout ratio (2023: ~19 %) and a 2.1 % dividend yield as of Thursday 12 June. The cum-date and payment date were not announced.

tickerNews.title: NICL Announces Interim Dividend for FY 2025
tickerNews.content: PAM Mineral (ticker NICL) will distribute an interim dividend for FY 2025 of about IDR 159.5 billion, or IDR 15 per share, indicating a 1.2 % dividend yield as of Thursday 12 June. The cum-date is on the regular market and the negotiation date is 20 June 2025, with payment scheduled for 30 June 2025.

tickerNews.title: FASW Rights Issue Details
tickerNews.content: Fajar Surya Wisesa plans a rights issue of approximately 743.4 million new shares at an exercise price of IDR 4,700 per share, a 10 : 3 ratio that would dilute existing shareholders by about 23.08 %. The expected proceeds of roughly IDR 3.5 trillion will be used for loan repayment and working-capital needs. The cum-date is on the regular market and the negotiation date is 19 June 2025, with the rights-issue trading period from 25 June to 2 July 2025.
